attributes.action: hold a binding referendum on whether politicians should be allowed to have 'other interests' while serving as elected MPs
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: MPs are elected by us! When elected they should do everything they can to represent their constituents and voice their concerns in parliament. However a lot of voters would agree that MPs do little or nothing to represent them. One of the problems is that MPs have a conflict of interest (ie business ventures which they pursue), so their full time is not spent representing the electorate. I think the public should be allowed a binding referendum on whether we think this is acceptable.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence –
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/probity/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
